item.title: How I Dockerize My Flask App With Pypy and Supervisord
item.description: There are bunch of ways how to deploy your Flask application, it can be directly with Flask’s built in http server or use UWSGI as gateway interface, with or without Nginx as your HTTP frontend. People also either run Flask application directly on their machine or as a container with docker. In this post, I will share the way I deploy my Flask application. Lately, I prefer to use PyPy rather than using pure Python to achieve more speed processing time (thanks to its JIT Compiler), and use Gevent to handle more concurrency.
